which Ipod is it?  Did you add anything to your fstab?
Does the instructions say to format it before use?
from what I can tell, they don't
do you have access to a windows machine?
I'd hate to advise you further.. I ended up getting my shuffle working be going to winxp first then back to ubuntu. I also added a line to my fstab.
the other thing you could try is to add a directory in /media called ipod before plugging it in. then plug it in and type sudo mount -a
the thing is, iTunes will format it and place the appropriate directories on the device.  without knowing what those are or where makes it tough.
you can also look at http://ipodlinux.org/Main_Page for more info.
